clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Intraoperative GDFT on the Postoperative Brain Edema
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Intraoperative Goal-directed Fluid Therapy (GDFT) on the Postoperative Brain Edema in Neurosurgical Patients With Malignant Supratentorial Gliomas

brief_summary.textblock: Whether a fluid protocol aiming for cardiac output augmentation or fluid restriction is favorable to post-craniotomy outcomes such as brain edema remains uncertain. To our knowledge, there has been no extensive and quantitative analysis of brain edema following SVV-based GDFT in neurosurgical patients with malignant supratentorial glioma. So the study aima to observe the effect of the stroke volume variation-based GDFT on the postoperative brain edema and decrease the incidence of postoperative complications in neurosurgical patients with malignant supratentorial gliomas.

primary_outcome.description: The volume of high intensity area on FLAIR MRI will be measured and then subtracted the volume of gadolinium enhanced lesion on T1-weighted MRI, and then the volume ratio to the preoperative volume will be calculated

arm_group.description: The patients will receive fluid therapy under SVV-directed goal.
The patients will receive fluid therapy without SVV-directed goal.

intervention.description: Target SVV will be titrated with fluid bolus, and thus individual amount varied depending on the SVV value at that time. Maintenance of oxygenation, hemoglobin, blood glucose, core temperature and hemodynamics, such as minimal cardiac indices, mean arterial pressure and heart rate, will be applied according to the same standard for each patient.

Fluid therapy will be done without goal-directed SVV . Maintenance of oxygenation, hemoglobin, blood glucose, core temperature and hemodynamics, such as minimal cardiac indices, mean arterial pressure and heart rate, will be applied according to the same standard for each patient.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Preoperative brain image indicating high-grade glioma (HGG), verified by postoperative histology of the World Health Organization (WHO) as grade III or IV tumors.
2. Age 18 -80 years.
3. Undergoing supratentorial brain tumour resection.
4. Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Renal insufficiency or the creatinine clearance is < 30 mL/kg.
2. Heart disease, New York Heart Association Functional Classification (NYHA) class II or higher heart failure, or if their cardiac ejection fraction is < 20%.
3. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
4. Extensive peripheral arterial occlusive disease.
5. Coagulopathy.
6. Surgery in the prone position.
